means: 使震惊( scandalize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She scandalized her family with her extravagant lifestyle.
sentence.Network_cn: 她奢侈的生活方式令家人侧目。

sentence.Network_en: People were scandalized at the slovenly management of the company.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们对该公司草率的经营感到愤慨.

sentence.Network_en: Giles Gosling himself was somewhat scandalized at the obstreperous nature of their mirth.
sentence.Network_cn: 吉尔斯·戈斯林本人看到大家高兴起来那么喧哗,有点难为情.

entry.tran: 冒犯;使震惊;使反感;使愤慨
entry.def: If something scandalizes people, they are shocked or offended by it.

example.ex: She scandalised her family by falling in love with a married man.
example.tran: 她爱上了一个已婚男子，这使得她的家人丢尽了脸。
